articles.description: Commodores senior Riley LaChance joins The Paul Finebaum Show to recap his game-winning shot vs. MSU and share his outlook on the rest of the season.
articles.headline: LaChance hopes Vandy can make late-season run

images.caption: Commodores senior Riley LaChance joins The Paul Finebaum Show to recap his game-winning shot vs. MSU and share his outlook on the rest of the season.
images.name: LaChance hopes Vandy can make late-season run

articles.description: Clemson junior guard Shelton Mitchell is out of the hospital but remains in the concussion protocol following an injury suffered during Wednesday's loss to Florida State.
articles.headline: Clemson's Shelton Mitchell exits hospital after hit to head

articles.description: Mark Schlabach joins OTL to discuss a U.S. District Court denying a motion to dismiss federal criminal charges against three of the 10 men arrested for their alleged roles in the FBI's two-year investigation into college basketball corruption.
articles.headline: Court denies dismissal off CBB probe

images.caption: Mark Schlabach joins OTL to discuss a U.S. District Court denying a motion to dismiss federal criminal charges against three of the 10 men arrested for their alleged roles in the FBI's two-year investigation into college basketball corruption.
images.name: Court denies dismissal off CBB probe

articles.description: Reggie Lynch maintains his innocence against sexual misconduct allegations but has dropped appeals of his Minnesota expulsion because he does not feel he could receive a fair hearing.
articles.headline: Reggie Lynch drops appeals of sexual misconduct rulings, accepts expulsion

articles.description: A U.S. District Court judge denied a motion Thursday to dismiss federal criminal charges against former Adidas executives James Gatto and Merl Code and former sports agent Christian Dawkins in the FBI's investigation into college basketball corruption.
articles.headline: Judge denies motion to drop charges in corruption case against ex-Adidas execs, agent

images.caption: Mark Schlabach joins OTL to discuss a U.S. District Court denying a motion to dismiss federal criminal charges against three of the 10 men arrested for their alleged roles in the FBI's two-year investigation into college basketball corruption.
images.name: Court denies dismissal off CBB probe

articles.description: With Kentucky missing an edge, along with a couple of pieces, could the reeling Wildcats miss the NCAA tourney for the second time under John Calipari?
articles.headline: Is this John Calipari's most disappointing Kentucky team ever?

images.caption: John Calipari has looked for ways to reach his young Kentucky team but hasn't found one yet.
images.name: John Calipari [576x324]

videos.description: West Virginia's Jevon Carter forces a steal and throws it ahead to Wesley Harris who takes his time rattling the rim as the Mountaineers are tied with the Red Foxes 8-8.
videos.headline: Carter steal turns into Harris slam

videos.description: Maris breaks the West Virginia press and gets the ball to Lasse Gummerus in the corner who drains the three as the buzzer sounds to cut the Red Foxes' deficit to 39-26.
videos.headline: 3 at buzzer keeps Marist in it

videos.description: West Virginia's James Bolden misses an open three, but Daxter Miles Jr. slides in the paint and leaps for the rebound and putback jumper through the foul.
videos.headline: Miles fires up crowd with putback and-1

videos.description: West Virginia's Wesley Harris deflects the pass and slams the ball with his left hand to put the Mountaineers back up 10 points against the Red Foxes.
videos.headline: Harris forces steal and slams on breakaway

videos.description: Marsit's David Kneudsen hits the final of his three consecutive 3s to bring the Red Foxes within 3 of the Mountaineers after trailing by double digits.
videos.headline: Marist bench erupts after Knudsen scores 9 consecutive points
